alert.note: Alert for Gila Bend; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 4:51PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 530 PM MST... At 451 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gila Bend Auxiliary Field, or near Gila Bend, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gila Bend, Gila Bend Auxiliary Field, Bosque, Cotton Center, Sonoran National Monument and Big Horn. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 99 and 141. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 1 and 15. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 1 and 16, and between mile markers 119 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Gila Bend; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Tonopah Desert
